A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll 6d10; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures in a 10 stud cone originating from you are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures and creatures that can't see).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell is blinded until the end of your next turn. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

At Higher Levels:

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d10 for each slot level above 1st.

import.name: Disguise Self
import.description:
You make yourself--including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person--look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 stud shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

import.name: Minor Illusion
import.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 3 stud cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

import.name: Minor Conjuration
import.description: Conjure a small inanimate object, no larger than 1 stud on any side, weighing no more than 1 brick.

import.name: Produce Flame
import.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 5 stud radius and dim light for an additional 5 stud. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 15 studs of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 fire damage.

Gains an additional damage dice with every 5 levels.

import.name: Benign Transposition
import.description:
You can teleport to a target location in range.

Anything in that area, if present, swaps places with you. If the area is occupied by a creature, that creature must be willing.

This spell has at most 1 charge that is restored by a long rest or by casting a conjuration spell. A charge is needed to cast the spell.

import.name: Create Transmuter's Stone
import.description:
Create a Transmuter's Stone.

The stone grants one of the below properties, whose properties can be changed if the creature carrying the stone casts a transmutation spell.

+ Darkvision
+ 5 stud increased movement
+ Constitution Saving Throw Proficiency
+ 50% Resistance to Acid
+ 50% Resistance to Cold
+ 50% Resistance to Fire
+ 50% Resistance to Lightning
+ 50% Resistance to Thunder

import.name: Ink Cloud
import.description:
Heavily obscures the affected area.

(Disadvantage on attacks & perception that would fall in the area or require the creature to see past the area).

import.name: Simple Mimicry
import.description: You can mimic simple sounds to confuse near-by creatures into believing the sound is real on a failed save.

import.name: Charge
import.description: Charge target creature, dealing damage and knocking them prone on a failed saving throw.

import.name: Identify
import.description:
You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

import.name: Suggestion
import.description:
You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.

import.name: Non-Detection
import.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 studs in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages
import.description:
Choose 1 skill in which you are not proficient.

For 10 minutes, you are proficient in that skill.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Read Thoughts
import.description:
If a creature succeeds its saving throw, you can not target this creature again until after a long rest.

On a failed saving throw, you have access to the creatures surface thoughts and current emotions, and as an action may choose to end this spell and cast "Suggestion" without using a spell slot and the creature automatically fails its saving throw against the cast of suggestion.

import.name: Healing Word
import.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

import.name: Acid Splash
import.description: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one or two creatures you can see within range. If you choose two, they must be within the spell's radius of each other. A target must succeed their saving throw or take damage.

import.name: Erelliaâ€™s Scorcher
import.description: A line of roaring flame emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

import.name: Gust
import.description:
You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:

+ One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 3 studs away from you.

+ You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 bricks. The object is pushed up to 5 studs away from you. It isnâ€™t pushed with enough force to cause damage.

You create a harmless sensory affect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters shut, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

import.name: Message
import.description:
You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence blocks this spell.

import.name: Prestidigitation
import.description:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

+ You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
+ You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
+ You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic stud.
+ You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic stud of nonliving material for 1 hour.
+ You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
+ You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

import.name: Tashaâ€™s hideous laughter
import.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see in range must succeed a wisdom saving throw or fall prone in a fit of laughter, unable to get up for the duration of the spell or until you release concentration.

A creature with intelligence 4 or less is unaffected.

Affected creatures gain the "Prone" effect for 10 rounds (1 minute)

import.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
import.description:
All undead within 15 studs of you must make a wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, that creature can only move away from you without willingly move to within 15 studs of you.

Additionally, the creature can not take reactions (Such as attacks of opportunity) and it must use its action to dash away from you on its turn.

On taking damage, this effect fades.

import.name: Natural Illusionist
import.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 3 stud cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

import.name: Bardic Inspiration
import.description:
You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 30 studs of you (possibly further depending on the instrument used) who can hear you. That creature gains one ${Bardic Inspiration Die}$, a d6.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the ${Bardic Inspiration Die}$, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the ${Bardic Inspiration Die}$ is rolled, it is lost.

A creature can have only one ${Bardic Inspiration Die}$ at a time.

Your ${Bardic Inspiration Die}$ changes when you reach certain levels in this class.
+ Level 5: d8
+ Level 10: d10
+ Level 15: d12
import.note: Find someway to add performance checks to this to make it more interesting?

import.name: Lightning Bolt
import.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes full lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

import.name: Ball Lightning
import.description:
Hurl a large ball of lightning at a target and upon landing erupts in a ball of lightning.

If it hits a creature along the way it simply passes through if it isn't the target unless it is a solid wall that fully blocks the path.

Targets that fail their saving throw that take more than ${26,,orange}$ damage are considered paralyzed.

import.name: Fear
import.description:
You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration.

While frightened by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

import.name: Gaseous Form
import.description:
You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 5 studs. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when stunned or otherwise incapacitated.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.

Target gains the "Gaseous Form" effect

import.name: Haste
import.description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

Creature gains the "Haste" effect.

import.name: Hypnotic Pattern
import.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside the cube area. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes.

Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed for the duration. While charmed by this spell, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

import.name: Lemuli's Tiny Hut
import.description:
A 12 stud radius (12 x 12 x 12) immovable cube appears around you. The spell ends if you leave this area.

If more than 9 creatures are in the space or a creature is on the border, the spell fails.

Creatures in the area when the spell is cast can enter and leave freely the hut freely. All other creatures are barred from entering the space. Spells and magical effects can not pass the boundary. This applies to hostile creatures as well.

The atmosphere in the hut is comfortable and dry regardless of the outside environment. Air is created as part of the spell and is made regardless as long as the spell is not voided by disruptive magics such as ${Anti-Magic Zones}$ or ${Counterspell}$.

The hut is opaque from the inside and outside obscuring view of what is outside. You choose the color and light on the interior and exterior separately.

The Hut is vulnerable to being dispelled.

import.name: Major Image
import.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than the cubic range. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the illusion, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

**At Higher Levels**: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your concentration.

import.name: Crane's Minute Meteors
import.description:
You create six tiny meteors in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spellâ€™s duration. When you cast the spell â€” and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter â€” you can expend one or two of the meteors, sending them streaking toward a point or points you choose within 60 studs of you. Once a meteor reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, the meteor explodes. Each creature within 3 studs of the point where the meteor explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of meteors created increases by two for each slot level above 3rd.

Gain the effect "Crane's Minute Meteors" to track your meteors.

import.name: Phantom Steed
import.description:
A Large quasi-real, horse appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You can choose some parts of the steed's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 5 studs away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics for a riding horse, except it has a speed of 50 studs and can travel 10 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.

Any physical attacks simply pass through the phantom form, but any attacks with arcane or divine energy that hit it immediately dispel it.

For every level over level 3 at which this spell is cast adds an hour to the duration of the steed.

import.name: Plant Growth
import.description:
This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 50 stud radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 studs of movement for every 1 stud it moves.

You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested. Should you opt to channel this way, the land slowly heals for a percentage of the time cast and can be interrupted and retain the healing. However you must finish the spell to gain the harvesting yield.

import.name: Stinking Cloud
import.description:
You create a sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

import.name: Tidal Wave
import.description: You conjure up a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range filling as much of the area as you desire. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isnâ€™t knocked prone. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 15 studs of it, and then it vanishes.

import.name: Wall of Sand
import.description: You conjure up a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 15 studs long, 5 studs high, and 5 studs thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is blinded while in the wallâ€™s space and must spend 3 studs of movement for every 1 stud it moves there.

import.name: Wall of Water
import.description:
You create a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 15 studs long, 5 studs high, and 1 stud thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 10 studs in diameter, 5 studs high, and 1 stud thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends. The wallâ€™s space is difficult terrain.

Any ranged weapon attack that enters the wallâ€™s space has disadvantage on the attack roll, and fire damage is halved if the fire effect passes through the wall to reach its target. Spells that deal cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze solid (at least a 5-foot-square section is frozen). Each 3-square-stud frozen section has AC 5 and 15 hit points. Reducing a frozen section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the wallâ€™s water doesnâ€™t fill it.

import.name: Wind Wall
import.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 25 studs long, 8 studs high, and 1 stud thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

import.name: Bone Armor
import.description:
Convert up to 2 raised skeletons from their skeletal form to armor around target creature adding 1AC to that creature.

The consumed skeletons still count towards the locked spell slot and the effect is removed if the slot is unlocked.

When cast at a higher level, you may consume an additional 2 skeletons and grant bone armor to another creature.

Target creatures gain the effect "Bone Armor"

import.name: Arcane Eye
import.description:
You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration.

You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and ${Dark Vision}$ out to ${15,,orange}$ studs. The eye can turn and look in any direction but only has a 60<sup>o</sup> viewing arc.

As an ${Action}$, you can move the eye up to ${15,,orange}$ studs in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it canâ€™t enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eyeâ€™s movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as a ${1,,orange}$ stud square.

import.name: Aura of Life
import.description:
Life preserving energy radiates from you, filling the area around you. Each non-hostile creature in the area, including you, takes 50% less necrotic damage and those creatures can not have their maximum HP reduced.

If a non-hostile in the creature starts its turn in the aura at 0HP, it gains 1HP.

import.name: Aura of Purity
import.description:
Purifying energy radiates from you in an aura around you that follows you until the spell ends.

Each non-hostile creature in the aura can't become diseased, takes 50% reduced damage from poison, and has advantage on saving throws that cause any of the following conditions:  
+ Blinded
+ Charmed
+ Deafened
+ Frightened
+ Paralyzed
+ Poisoned
+ Stunned

import.name: Banishment
import.description:
You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

If the target is native to the plane of existence you're on, you banish the target to a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is incapacitated. The target remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target is banished with a faint popping noise, returning to its home plane. If the spell ends before 1 minute has passed, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Otherwise, the target doesn't return.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

import.name: Compulsion
import.description:
Creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it can't be charmed. On a failed save, a target is affected by this spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to designate a direction that is horizontal to you.

Each affected target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. It can take its action before it moves. After moving in this way, it can make another Wisdom saving throw to try to end the effect.

A target isn't compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit, but it will provoke opportunity attacks to move in the designated direction.

import.name: Confusion
import.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature within the sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll a d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

+ 1: The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.  
+ 2-6: The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.  
+ 7&8: The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.  
+ 9&0: The creature can act and move normally.  

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

import.name: Misty Step
import.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see in range.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Sacred Weapon
import.description:
As an action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy, using your Channel Divinity. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon. The weapon also emits bright light in a 15 stud radius and dim light another 15 studs beyond that. If the weapon is not already magical, it becomes magical for the duration.

You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall unconscious, this effect ends.

Gain the effect: Sacred Weapon

import.name: Channel Divinity: Turn the Unholy
import.description:
As an action, you present your holy Symbol and speak a prayer censuring Fiends and Undead, using your Channel Divinity. Each fiend or Undead that can see or hear you within 20 studs of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it canâ€™t willingly move to a space within 20 studs of you. It also canâ€™t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If thereâ€™s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Turn the Faithless
import.description:
You can use your Channel Divinity to utter ancient words that are painful for fey and fiends to hear. As an action, you present your holy symbol, and each fey or fiend within 24 studs of you that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it canâ€™t willingly move to a space within 20 studs of you. It also canâ€™t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If thereâ€™s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

If the creatureâ€™s true form is concealed by an illusion, shapeshifting, or other effect, that form is revealed while it is turned.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Nature's Wrath
import.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke primeval forces to ensnare a foe. As an action, you can cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 8 studs of you that you can see. The creature must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) or be restrained. While restrained by the vines, the creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it frees itself and the vines vanish.

import.name: Moonbeam
import.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down on a point within range. Until the spell ends, dim light fills the cylinder.

When a creature enters the spellâ€™s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in ghostly flames that cause searing pain, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes full damage on a failed save, or half damage on a successful one.

A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its original form and canâ€™t assume a different form until it leaves the spellâ€™s light.

On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the beam 30 studs in any direction.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Abjure Enemy
import.description:
As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer of denunciation, using your Channel Divinity. Choose one creature within 40 studs of you that you can see. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, unless it is immune to being frightened. Fiends and undead have disadvantage on this saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. While frightened, the creatureâ€™s speed is 0, and it canâ€™t benefit from any bonus to its speed.

On a successful save, the creatureâ€™s speed is halved for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

import.name: Channel Divinity: Vow of Enmity
import.description: As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within range, using your Channel Divinity. You gain advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls unconscious.

import.name: Iceball
import.description:
Hurl a large Ice Ball at a location.

The ball explodes on impact.

If hit with a failed saving throw, make a constitution saving throw or be slowed.

import.name: Charm Person
import.description:
You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it.

If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within ${15,,orange}$ studs of the first creature targeted.

import.name: Entangle
import.description:
Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 15 stud square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
 
When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

import.name: Faerie Fire
import.description:
Each object in a 15-stud cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-stud radius. 

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

Targets gain the effect "Faeire Fire" for the duration if affected.

import.name: Vicious Mockery
import.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. 

Gains an additional damage dice with every 5 levels.

import.name: Unseen Servant
import.description:
This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. 

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command. 

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

import.name: False Life
import.description:
Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points for the duration.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 1st.

import.name: Chill Touch
import.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell Attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an Undead target, it also has disadvantage on Attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

Gains an additional damage dice with every 5 levels.

import.name: Compose Bone Wolf
import.description: You can forge 3 skeletons into a Bone Wolf.

import.name: Divination
import.description:
Your magic and an offering put you in contact with a god or a godâ€™s servants. You ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The GM offers a truthful reply. The reply might be a short phrase, a cryptic rhyme, or an omen.

The spell doesnâ€™t take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading. The GM makes this roll in secret.

import.name: Heat Metal
import.description:
Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a Bonus Action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks until the start of your next turn.

import.name: Arcane Portcullis
import.description:
Concentrate on and name a creature that is on your current plane of existence. That creature then suddenly appears at a location of your choice within ${30,,darkorange}$ studs of your current location.

Is the named creature saves against your spell, it may choose to accept the summoning.

import.name: Blessing of Dionysus
import.description:
You touch and bless up to ${wis/2,, orange}$ kegs of any alcohol, blessing them for ${1,,orange}$ hour. Any body of alcohol can only be blessed once per day.

Any drinks poured from the blessed container are considered to have this blessing and a creature can only benefit from this blessing once per long rest.

Any creature regardless of subtype (undead, construct, humanoid, fiend, etc) is healed ${(wis)d4,, orange}$ when they consume a blessed drink. Additionally, they must pass a DC${6+ 2*wis,, orange}$ constitution saving throw or become ${Lush,, orange}$ for 1 hour, during which they have an unusually strong love for ${Dionysus,, orange}$, a strong desire for more alcohol, and have disadvantage on all saves and checks.

Being ${Lush,, orange}$ does not prevent the creature from becoming ${Drunk,, orange}$ as well.

import.name: Dimension Door
import.description:
You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "100 studs straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45- degree angle, 140 studs."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 studs of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take ${4,,orange}$d6 ${Force,,orange}$ damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

For every level above level 4 at which this spell is cast, you may move another ${50,, orange}$ studs.

import.name: Wing Attack
import.description:
You beat your wings, creating strong gusts.

All creatures within range of you must make a saving throw. On failure, they are knocked prone and take full damage. On a success, they only take half damage.

import.name: Frightful Pressence
import.description:
You choose any number of creatures within range of you and cast a terrifying gaze unto them.

On a failed save, they receive the ${Feared}$ effect with you as the source.

import.name: Black Dragon Claws
import.description: You can attack with your claws.

import.name: Black Dragon Bite
import.description: You can attack with your bite.

import.name: Black Dragon Tail
import.description: You can attack with your tail.

import.name: Comfy Hammock
import.description:
Targeting a space between 2 poles, you summon a magical mesh hammock.

While in the hammock, you may sleep protected from undesired disturbances. When cast, choose any number of creatures that may interact with you while in the hammock. Other creatures are not able to interact with you while you are in the hammock, though you do appear present.

Once you leave the hammock, you may choose to dismiss it.

If someone else sleeps in your hammock, they must pass a ${Wisdom}$ save against your spell DC or remain in the hammock longer, revealing in its comfiness.

Additionally, if someone else sleeps in your hammock, they are subject to the creatures chosen by you, and do not get to decide on their own.

import.name: Necrotic Pulse
import.description:
A pulse of dark energy erupts from your hands towards a target area.

Any creature that fully resists the damage is instead healed.

import.name: Thought Shield
import.description: You weave a clouding veil over the mind of one creature you touch. For the duration, the targetâ€™s mind canâ€™t be read or detected, creatures canâ€™t telepathically communicate with the target unless the target allows it.

import.name: Mental Barrier
import.description: You protect your mind with a wall of looping, repetitive thought. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on ${Intelligence,,orange}$, ${Wisdom,,orange}$, and ${Charisma,,orange}$ saving throws.

import.name: Commune
import.description:
You contact your deity or a divine proxy and ask up to ${wis/2 + 1,,orange}$ questions (Increasing with Wisdom) that can be answered with a ${Yes}$. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings arenâ€™t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive ${Unclear}$ as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deityâ€™s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deityâ€™s interests, the GM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative ${25,,orange}$ percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer. The GM makes this roll in secret.

import.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
import.description:
You make natural terrain in range look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Thus, open fields or a road can be made to resemble a swamp, hill, crevasse, or some other difficult or impassable terrain. A pond can be made to seem like a grassy meadow, a precipice like a gentle slope, or a rock-strewn gully like a wide and smooth road. Manufactured structures, equipment, and creatures within the area arenâ€™t changed in appearance.

The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isnâ€™t obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an ${Investigation}$ check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is, sees it as a vague image superimposed on the terrain.

import.name: See Invisibility
import.description: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the  ${Ethereal Plane}$. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

import.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
import.description:
A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ${Ranged Spell Attack}$ until the spell ends.

At the end of each of the targetâ€™s turns, it can make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

import.name: Phantasmal Killer
import.description: You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusory manifestation of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a ${Wisdom}$ damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

import.name: Locate Creature
import.description:
Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creatureâ€™s location, as long as that creature is within range of you. If the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific creature known to you, or the nearest creature of a specific kind (such as a human or a unicorn), so long as you have seen such a creature up closeâ€”within 15 studsâ€”at least once. If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effects of a ${Polymorph}$ spell, this spell doesnâ€™t locate the creature.

This spell canâ€™t locate a creature if running water at least ${5,,orange}$ studs wide blocks a direct path between you and the creature.

import.name: Resilient Sphere
import.description:
A sphere of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of ${Large}$ saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration.

Nothingâ€”not physical objects, energy, or other spell effectsâ€”can pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the sphere can breathe there. The sphere is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside canâ€™t be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the sphere damage anything outside it.

The sphere is weightless and just large enough to contain the creature or object inside. An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphereâ€™s walls and thus roll the sphere at up to half the creatureâ€™s speed. Similarly, the globe can be picked up and moved by other creatures.

A ${Disintegrate}$ spell targeting the globe destroys it without harming anything inside it.

import.name: Private Sanctum
import.description:
You make an area within range magically secure. The area is a cube that can be as small as ${5,,orange}$ studs to as large as ${50,,orange}$ studs on each side. The spell lasts for the duration or until you use an ${Action}$ to dismiss it.

When you cast the spell, you decide what sort of security the spell provides, choosing any or all of the following properties:
+ Sound canâ€™t pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
+ The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including darkvision) through it.
+ Sensors created by divination spells canâ€™t appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
+ Creatures in the area canâ€™t be targeted by divination spells.
+ Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
+ Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

Casting this spell on the same spot every day for a year makes this effect permanent.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can increase the size of the cube by ${50,,orange}$ studs for each slot level beyond 4th. Thus you could protect a cube that can be up to ${100,,orange}$ studs on one side by using a spell slot of 5th level.

import.name: Polymorph
import.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, until the target drops to 0 hit points, or the target dies. The new form can be any non-magical beast whose ${Size}$ is the same or less than the target's. The targetâ€™s game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesnâ€™t reduce the creatureâ€™s normal form to 0 hit points, it isnâ€™t knocked unconscious.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it canâ€™t speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The targetâ€™s gear melds into the new form. The creature canâ€™t activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

import.name: Cloudkill
import.description:
You create a sphere of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. 

The area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spellâ€™s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a ${Constitution}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or donâ€™t need to breathe. The fog moves ${5,,orange}$ studs away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

import.name: Conjure Elemental
import.description:
You call forth an elemental servant.

Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water that fills a 5-stud cube within range. An elemental of ${Threat}$  rating 6 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 5 studs of it.

For example, a fire elemental emerges from a bonfire, and an earth elemental rises up from the ground.

The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you donâ€™t issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesnâ€™t disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental canâ€™t be dismissed by you, and it disappears ${1,,orange}$ hour after you summoned it. The GM has the elementalâ€™s statistics.

**At Higher Levels**: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the ${Threat}$ rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

import.name: Contact Other Plane
import.description:
You mentally contact a demigod, the spirit of a long-dead sage, or some other mysterious entity from another plane. Contacting this extraplanar intelligence can strain or even break your mind. When you cast this spell, make an ${Intelligence}$, you canâ€™t take actions, canâ€™t understand what other creatures say, canâ€™t read, and speak only in gibberish. A greater restoration spell cast on you ends this effect.

On a successful save, you can ask the entity up to five questions. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. The GM answers each question with one word, such as "yes", "no", "maybe", "never", "irrelevant", or "unclear" (if the entity doesnâ€™t know the answer to the question). If answering does against the creature's motiviations or goals, it may lie, which can be detected with a successful ${Insight}$. But unless directly against that creature's interests, it will answer truthfully. If a one-word answer would be misleading, the GM might instead offer a short phrase as an answer.

import.name: Awaken
import.description:
After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller beast or plant. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence below your of ${Wisdom}$. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. If the target is a plant, it gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a humanâ€™s. Your GM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened plant, such as the statistics for the awakened shrub or the awakened tree.

The awakened beast or plant is charmed by you for the duration or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. When the charmed condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was charmed.

import.name: Wall Of Fire
import.description:
You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to ${30,,orange}$ studs long, ${10,,orange}$ studs high, and ${1,,orange}$ stud thick, or a ringed wall up to ${10,,orange}$ studs in diameter, ${10,,orange}$ studs high, and ${1,,orange}$ stud thick.

The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a ${Dexterity}$ damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals damage to each creature that ends its turn within ${5,,orange}$ studs of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. 

The other side of the wall deals no damage.

import.name: Fire Shield
import.description:
Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a ${5,,orange}$ stud radius and dim light for an additional ${5,,orange}$ studs. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The flames provide you with one of the following:
+ ${Warm Shield}$
	+ Reduces ${Cold}$ damage by 4d8
	+ Creatures making melee attacks against you without reach take 2d8 ${Fire}$ damage
+ ${Chill Shield}$
	+ Reduces ${Fire}$ damage by 4d8
	+ Creatures making melee attacks against you without reach take 2d8 ${Cold}$ damage

import.name: Fabricate
import.description:
You convert raw materials into products of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a wooden bridge from a clump of trees, a rope from a patch of hemp, and clothes from flax or wool.

Choose raw materials that you can see within range. You can fabricate an object contained within a cube of ${int,,orange}$ studs on each side (Increases with your ${Intelligence}$ modifier), given a sufficient quantity of raw material. The quality of objects made by the spell is commensurate with the quality of the raw materials.

Creatures or magic items canâ€™t be created or transmuted by this spell. You also canâ€™t use it to create items that ordinarily require a high degree of craftsmanship, such as jewelry, weapons, glass, or armor, unless you have proficiency with the type of artisanâ€™s tools used to craft such objects.

import.name: Faithful Hound
import.description:
You conjure a phantom watchdog in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, where it remains for the duration, until you dismiss it as an action, or until you move more than ${100,,orange}$ studs away from it.

The hound is invisible to all creatures except you and canâ€™t be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within ${15,,orange}$ studs feet of it without first speaking the password that you specify when you cast this spell, the hound starts barking loudly. The hound sees invisible creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane. It ignores illusions.

At the start of each of your turns, the hound attempts to bite one creature within ${5,,orange}$ studs of it that is hostile to you. For the attack, roll a ${Spell Attack}$ damage.

The hound does not move from its summoned location except to attack a creature within its range.

import.name: Death Ward
import.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death.

The first time the target would drop to ${0,,orange}$ hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to ${1,,orange}$ hit point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spells ends.

The enchanted creature gains the effect ${Death Warded}$.

import.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
import.description:
You summon elementals that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. You choose one the following options for what appears:
+ One elemental of ${Threat}$ rating 3 or lower
+ Two elementals of ${Threat}$ rating 2 or lower
+ Four elementals of ${Threat}$ rating 1 or lower
+ Eight elementals of ${Threat}$ rating 0

You must know of an elemental that fits the needed class to use it. See your ${Knowledge}$.

An elemental summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you donâ€™t issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The GM has the creaturesâ€™ statistics.

While casting, you can not move.

**At Higher Levels**: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level Spell Slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear - twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot

import.name: Detect Thoughts
import.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within range of you. If the creature you choose has an ${Intelligence}$ or doesnâ€™t speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creatureâ€”what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creatureâ€™s thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creatureâ€™s mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a ${Wisdom}$ check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you canâ€™t see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within range of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but ${1,,orange}$ stud of rock, ${1/3,,orange}$ a block of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You canâ€™t detect a creature with an ${Intelligence}$ or lower or one that doesnâ€™t speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you canâ€™t see it, but it must still be within range.

import.name: Find Steed
import.description:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a warhorse, a pony, a camel, an elk, or a mastiff. The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an ${Intelligence}$ becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed.

When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an ${Action}$, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum.

While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically.

You canâ€™t have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an ${Action}$, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.

Other spells exist for summoning other animals.

import.name: Chain Lightning
import.description:
You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range.

This bolt then jumps to up to three other creatures or objects. Each subsequent target must be within the spell's radius. Depending on line of sight from the last creature or object hit, you may choose the next creature or object.

However, if an sufficiently grounded object is targeted, the chain will end there. For instance, if a point on the ground is chosen to go around a wall, then the ground will absorb all the remaining arcs.

Any target may make a ${Dexterity}$ saving throw against your Spell DC to attempt to take half damage.

**At Higher Levels**: One additional leap from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

import.name: Greater Invisibility
import.description:
You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the targetâ€™s person.

If the creature picks anything up or attacks, it remains invisible. Additionally, any acquired items of size 12 blocks or less also become invisible. Any items acquired with a size greater than 12 blocks simply appear to float in the air.

import.name: Improved Icebolt
import.description:
Throw an arcane shard of ice at a target that explodes on impact.

If the creature succeeds their saving throw, they take half damage.

If the shard explodes near the a surface, a ${wis,,orange}$ radius (Based on your ${Wisdom}$ Modifier) ice surface is created on the surface around the target. Any creatures that walk across into or off of that surface must pass a dexterity save against your DC or lose all their movement and fall prone.

import.name: Teleportation Circle
import.description:
As you cast the spell, you draw a 10-stud-diameter circle on the ground inscribed with sigils that link your location to a permanent teleportation circle of your choice whose sigil sequence you know and that is on the same plane of existence as you. A shimmering portal opens within the circle you drew and remains open until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the portal instantly appears within 5 studs of the destination circle or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

Many major temples, guilds, and other important places have permanent teleportation circles inscribed somewhere within their confines. Each such circle includes a unique sigil sequence - a string of magical runes arranged in a particular pattern. You can learn sigil sequences during your adventures for teleportation circles with which to connect. You can commit a new sigil sequence to memory after studying it for 1 minute.

You can create a permanent teleportation circle by casting this spell in the same location every day for one year. You need not use the circle to teleport when you cast the spell in this way.

import.name: Scrying
import.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows youâ€™re casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge Save Modifier
+ Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5
+ Firsthand (you have met the target) +0
+ Familiar (you know the target well) âˆ’5
+ Connection Save Modifier
+ Likeness or picture âˆ’2
+ Possession or garment âˆ’4
+ Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like âˆ’10

On a successful save, the target isnâ€™t affected, and you canâ€™t use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 studs of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 7 studs of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesnâ€™t move.

import.name: Resurrection
import.description:
You touch a dead creature, or part of a dead creature, that has been dead for no more than a century, that didnâ€™t die of old age, and that isnâ€™t undead. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with all its hit points.
This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures normal diseases afflicting the creature when it died. It doesnâ€™t, however, remove magical diseases, curses, and the like; if such effects arenâ€™t removed prior to casting the spell, they afflict the target on its return to life.

If other parts of the dead creature are scattered throughout the world, they are magically teleported to your current location to re-assemble the dead if the spell works.

This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.
Coming back from the dead is an ordeal.

The revived creature receives -5 to all skills and saves for the first day, reducing by 1 every day after.

The toll on your own body is significant as well, reducing your own abilities by -3 and also fading day by day. Each crystal in the formation beyond the 6th reduces this effect by 1.

Requires a ${Arcane Cyan Formation}$ (${6,,orange}$+) and knowledge of the ${Ancient}$ language to perform this spell. Additionally, all power crystals in the formation are consumed. Each crystal beyond the 6th reducing the time for you to recover.

Once cast, perform an ${Arcana}$ or ${Religion}$ check.

An ${Arcana}$ check involves your power alone and can in some cases force an unwilling creature back to life, but as the entirety of the power comes from you, it is more difficult.

A ${Religion}$ check works with the creature being revived and therefore only works with creatures that wish to be bought back. In this case, the target's spirit may also contribute to your cast of the spell.

In both cases, other creatures in the area may help with the casting of the spell, with the effect diminishing with every creature after the first and usually fading after the third. Each helping to persuade the target's spirit to return.

import.name: Rebirth
import.description:
You name a creature to bring back to life.

If it is someone with whom you are intimately familiar (Of whom you have more than passing knowledge of and have been in direct contact with at least twice for several hours each time), then there is no additional skill check required and a nickname is acceptable.

If you are not intimately familiar with the creature, it must have been dead for less than 300 years and its true name must be spoken. The skill check required depends on the named creature, the circumstances under which you are attempting to bring it back, how long it has been dead, and its willingness to return. Note that this spell can compel an unwilling creature to return.

If the creature turns out to be unwilling but the spell would have succeeded otherwise, the creature will truthful answer a number of questions equal to your your ${Wisdom}$ modifier divided by 2 and rounded down (${wis/2,,orange}$).

If successful, that creature is restored with full health, no ailments beyond those of this rebirth, and a full body. If other parts of the dead creature are scattered throughout the world, they are magically disintegrated.

The revived creature receives -10 to all skills and saves for the first day, reducing by 1 every day after.

The toll on your own body is significant as well, reducing your own abilities by -10 and also fading day by day. Each crystal in the formation beyond the 4th reduces this effect by 1.

Requires a ${Golden Halo Formation}$ (${3,,orange}$+) and knowledge of the ${Ancient}$ language to perform this spell. Additionally, all power crystals in the formation are consumed. Each crystal beyond the 4th reducing the time for you to recover.
import.note: Notable circumstance for corpseless rebirth are the plane of origin and the plane of death.

import.name: Greater Restoration
import.description:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the targetâ€™s exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:
+ One effect that charmed or petrified the target
+ One curse, including the targetâ€™s attunement to a cursed magic item
+ Any reduction to one of the targetâ€™s ability scores
+ One effect reducing the targetâ€™s hit point maximum

The spell reduces the integrity of the power crystal but does not fully consume it.

import.name: Mass Cure Wounds
import.description:
A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures with-in the radius of the resulting sphere at that point.

Each target in that area is healed. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

import.name: Heal
import.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. A surge of positive energy washes through the creature, causing it to heal. This spell also ends ${Blindness}$, ${Deafness}$, and any ${Diseases}$ affecting the target.

This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

import.name: Mass Heal
import.description:
A flood of healing energy flows from you into injured creatures around you. You restore up to ${600 + 10*(wis + int),,orange}$ hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures that you can see within range. This spell also ends ${Blindness}$, ${Deafness}$, and any ${Diseases}$ affecting the target.

This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

import.name: Protection from Energy
import.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has ${50,,orange}$% resistance to one damage type of your choice: ${Acid}$, ${Cold}$, ${Fire}$, ${Lightning}$, or ${Thunder}$. Target gains "Protection from [Choosen Type]". For example "Protection from Acid".

import.name: Thought Transferance
import.description:
You are able to touch a willing creature and directly transfer an idea, memory, or thought directly to it.

The target creature must then make a successful save against your spell or be driven mad, losing all ability to concentrate or cast spells and begins to attack near by creatures at random. Additionally, the target does not receive the transferred thought.

Unwilling creatures refuse to open their mind to you and the spell has no effect. Attempting to do so results in a temporary migraine, dealing ${2*int,,orange}$d6 ${Psychic}$ damage.

The complexity of what you can send is limited by your ${Intelligence}$. While simple information can be exchanged freely, entire memories, dreams, or disturbing thoughts can be transferred as well, however the target will know what is real and what is false beyond any doubt.

If attempting to transfer knowledge of a spell, you can transfer any spell up to Level ${(int-1)/2,,orange}$, increasing with your ${Intelligence}$ modifier.

import.name: Slam
import.description:
You slam into an object or creature with part of your form.

This ability acts as an attack action.

import.name: Touch
import.description: If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it gains the ${Ignited}$ Effect, resulting in fire damage over time.

import.name: Raise Corpse
import.description:
Raise a dead corpse to follow you.

The raised corpse moves and is capable of basic speech similar to when it was alive.

Its stats however are as though it were a normal creature of its race.

import.name: Whirlwind
import.description: Each creature in range (Typically in the same space as you) must make a ${Strength}$ saving throw. On a failure, an affected creature takes full damage and is flung up 10 studs away in a random direction and knocked prone. If that creature strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 1d6 ${Bludgeoning}$ damage for every ${5,,orange}$ studs it was thrown. If the affected creature is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC${13,,orange}$ Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, an affected creature takes half damage and is not flung, nor knocked prone.

import.name: Ice Lance
import.description:
Hurl a blistering cold chunk of ice from your body in any direction, dealing damage to all creatures and objects in its path.

If the lance hits any creature larger than you that fails its saving throw, then the lance stops, otherwise creatures that fail their saving throw take an additional 1d8 ${Piercing}$ damage and make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw or are ${Chilled}$ for the next minute, reducing movement speed and dealing 1d4 ${Cold}$.

This save is repeated at the end of every round and the effect ends on a successful save.

A single creature can only be attacked once by you with this ability per round. Though a single creature may be lanced by multiple creatures in one round.

import.name: Arc Lightning
import.description:
An arc of lightning jumps off of you toward the target, damaging it.

On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and the arc ends.

On a failed save, the creature takes full damage and the arc jumps to another creature that is within ${10+2*int,,orange}$ studs of the target and a single cast can not damage to a creature more than once.

import.name: Thunderous Burst
import.description:
You create a thunderous burst around you that damages all creatures adjacent to you.

Creatures struck that fail their save are pushed back${5 + int,,orange}$ studs and knocked prone.

After, roll 1d20. On a ${20,,orange}$ you may cast ${Arc Lightning}$.

import.name: Flameburst
import.description:
A wave of flame erupts from you damaging all creatures and objects within range of you.

When cast, roll 1d6; on a ${6,,orange}$ you regain a single spell slot of up to level ${3,,orange}$.

import.name: Bite
import.description: Bite at a target creature or object.

import.name: Chaos Bolt
import.description:
You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 + 1d6 damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the attacks damage type, as shown below.

d8 Result to choose the ${Chromatic}$ Damage Type:  
+ 1: ${Acid}$
+ 2: ${Cold}$
+ 3: ${Fire}$
+ 4: ${Force}$
+ 5: ${Lightning}$
+ 6: ${Poison}$
+ 7: ${Psychic}$
+ 8: ${Thunder}$

If you roll the same number on both d8s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within ${15,,orange}$ studs of the struck creature. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again. A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.
