This spell continues leaping as long as you roll doubles with the d8s.

import.name: Mind Spike
import.description:
You reach into the mind of one creature you can see within range. On a failed save the creature takes full damage, or half damage on a successful one.

On a failed save, you also know the target's location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target canâ€™t become hidden from you, and if itâ€™s invisible, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

import.name: Hex
import.description:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 ${Necrotic}$ damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability, giving them the effect "${Hexed [Ability]}$" for the duration, such as "${Hexed Perception}$".

Abilities from which to choose:
+ ${Acrobatics}$
+ ${Animal Handling}$
+ ${Arcana}$
+ ${Atheletics}$
+ ${Concentration}$
+ ${Deception}$
+ ${History}$
+ ${Insight}$
+ ${Intimidation}$
+ ${Investigation}$
+ ${Medicine}$
+ ${Nature}$
+ ${Perception}$
+ ${Performance}$
+ ${Persuasion}$
+ ${Religion}$
+ ${Slight of Hand}$
+ ${Stealth}$
+ ${Survival}$

If the target drops to ${0,,orange}$ hit points before this spell ends, you can use a ${Bonus Action}$ on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.

A ${Remove Curse}$ cast on the target ends this spell early.

When this spell is cast at higher levels:
+ When you cast this spell using a spell slot of ${3,,orange}$<sup>rd</sup> or ${4,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to ${8,,orange}$ hours.
+ When you use a spell slot of ${5,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to ${24,,orange}$ hours.

import.name: Modify Memory
import.description:
You attempt to reshape another creatureâ€™s memories.

One creature that you can see must make a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes ${Charmed}$ by you for the duration. The charmed target is incapacitated and unaware of its surroundings, though it can still hear you. If it takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends, and none of the targetâ€™s memories are modified.

While this charm lasts, you can affect the targetâ€™s memory of an event that it experienced within the last ${24,,orange}$ hours and that lasted no more than ${10,,orange}$ minutes. You can permanently eliminate all memory of the event, allow the target to recall the event with perfect clarity and exacting detail, change its memory of the details of the event, or create a memory of some other event.

You must speak to the target to describe how its memories are affected, and it must be able to understand your language for the modified memories to take root. Its mind fills in any gaps in the details of your description. If the spell ends before you have finished describing the modified memories, the creatureâ€™s memory isnâ€™t altered. Otherwise, the modified memories take hold when the spell ends.

A modified memory doesnâ€™t necessarily affect how a creature behaves, particularly if the memory contradicts the creatureâ€™s natural inclinations, alignment, or beliefs. An illogical modified memory, such as implanting a memory of how much the creature enjoyed dousing itself in acid, is dismissed, perhaps as a bad dream. The DM might deem a modified memory too nonsensical to affect a creature in a significant manner.

${Greater Restoration}$ will clear the effect and restore the original state of the memory.

import.name: Hallow
import.description:
You touch a point and infuse an area around it with holy or unholy power. The area can have a radius up to ${40,,orange}$ studs, and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect a hallow spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects.

First, ${Celestials}$, ${Elementals}$, ${Fey}$, ${Fiends}$, and ${Undead}$ canâ€™t enter the area, nor can such creatures ${Charm}$, ${Frighten}$, or ${Possess}$ creatures within it. Any creature charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature is no longer charmed, frightened, or possessed upon entering the area. You can exclude one or more of those types of creatures from this effect.

Second, you can bind an extra effect to the area. Choose the effect from the following list:
+ ${Courage}$ : Affected creatures canâ€™t be frightened while in the area.
+ ${Darkness}$ : Darkness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, canâ€™t illuminate the area.
+ ${Daylight}$ : Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell canâ€™t extinguish the light.
+ ${Energy Protection}$ : Affected creatures in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
+ ${Energy Vulnerability}$ : Affected creatures in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
+ ${Everlasting Rest}$ : Dead bodies interred in the area canâ€™t be turned into undead.
+ ${Extradimensional Interference}$ : Affected creatures canâ€™t move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.
+ ${Fear}$ : Affected creatures are frightened while in the area.
+ ${Silence}$ : No sound can emanate from within the area, and no sound can reach into it.
+ ${Tongues}$ : Affected creatures can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they donâ€™t share a common language.

Some of these effects apply to creatures in the area. You can designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that follow a specific deity or leader, or creatures of a specific sort, such as ores or trolls.

When a creature that would be affected enters the spellâ€™s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a ${Charisma}$ saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.

import.name: Holy Weapon
import.description:
You imbue a weapon you touch with holy power. Until the spell ends, the weapon emits bright light in a ${15,,orange}$ stud radius and dim light for an additional ${15,,orange}$ stud.

In addition, weapon attacks made with it deal an extra 2d8 ${Radiant}$ damage on a hit. If the weapon isnâ€™t already a magic weapon, it becomes one for the duration.

As a ${Bonus Action}$ on your turn, you can dismiss this spell and cause the weapon to emit a burst of radiance. Each creature of your choice that you can see within ${15,,orange}$ studs of you must make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d8 ${Radiant}$ damage, and it is blinded for ${1,,orange}$ minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isnâ€™t blinded. 

At the end of each of its turns, a blinded creature can make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

import.name: Dawn
import.description:
The light of dawn shines down on a location you specify within range. Until the spell ends, bright light glimmers in the area of the spell's target.

This light is sunlight.

When the cylinder appears, each creature within it must make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw, taking full damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature must also make this saving throw whenever it ends its turn in the cylinder. If youâ€™re within ${30,,orange}$ studs of the cylinder, you can move it up to ${30,,orange}$ studs as a ${Bonus Action}$ on your turn.

import.name: Antimagic Field
import.description:
An invisible sphere of antimagic surrounds you.

This area is divorced from the magical energy that suffeses the multiverse. Within the sphere, spells canâ€™t be cast, summoned creatures disappear, and even magic items become mundane. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you.

Spells and other magical effects, except those created by an artifact or a deity, are suppressed in the sphere and canâ€™t protrude into it. A slot expended to cast a suppressed spell is consumed. While an effect is suppressed, it doesnâ€™t function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration.

+ ${Targeted Effects}$  
Spells and other magical effects, such as ${Magic Missile}$ and charm person, that target a creature or an object in the sphere have no effect on that target.

+ ${Areas of Magic}$  
The area of another spell or magical effect, such as fireball, canâ€™t extend into the sphere. If the sphere overlaps an area of magic, the part of the area that is covered by the sphere is suppressed. For example, the flames created by a wall of fire are suppressed within the sphere, creating a gap in the wall if the overlap is large enough.

+ ${Spells}$  
Any active spell or other magical effect on a creature or an object in the sphere is suppressed while the creature or object is in it.

+ ${Magic Items}$  
The properties and powers of magic items are suppressed in the sphere. For example, a +1 longsword in the sphere functions as a nonmagical longsword. A magic weaponâ€™s properties and powers are suppressed if it is used against a target in the sphere or wielded by an attacker in the sphere. If a magic weapon or piece of magic ammunition fully leaves the sphere (For example, if you fire a magic arrow or throw a magic spear at a target outside the sphere), the magic of the item ceases to be suppressed as soon as it exits.

+ ${Magical Travel}$  
Teleportation and planar travel fail to work in the sphere, whether the sphere is the destination or the departure point for such magical travel. A portal to another location, world, or plane of existence, as well as an opening to an extra-dimensional space such as that created by the rope trick spells, temporarily closes while in the sphere.

+ ${Creatures and Objects}$  
A creature or object summoned or created by magic temporarily winks out of existence in the sphere. Such a creature instantly reappears once the space the creature occupied is no longer within the sphere.

+ ${Dispel Magic}$  
Spells and magical effects such as dispel magic have no effect on the sphere. Likewise, the spheres created by different ${Antimagic Field}$ spells donâ€™t nullify each other.

import.name: Seeming
import.description:
This spell allows you to change the appearance of any number of creatures that you can see within range.
You give each target you choose a new, illusory appearance. An unwilling target can make a ${Charisma}$ saving throw, and if it succeeds, it is unaffected by this spell.

The spell disguises physicial appearances as well as clothing, armor, weapons, and equipment. You can make each creature seem ${1,,orange}$ stud shorter or taller and appear thin, fat, or inbetween. You canâ€™t change a targetâ€™s body type, so you must choose a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you. The spell lasts for the duration, unless you use your ${Action}$ to dismiss it sooner.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspections. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to a creatureâ€™s outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel the creatureâ€™s head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner then you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

A creature can use its ${Action}$ to inspect a target and make an ${Investigation}$ check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it becomes aware that the target is disguised.

import.name: Telekinesis
import.description:
You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought.

When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

### ${Creature}$

You can try to move a Huge or smaller creature. Make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by the creatureâ€™s ${Strength}$ check. If you win the contest, you move the creature up to ${15,,orange}$ studs in any direction, including upward but not beyond the range of this spell. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is restrained in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air.
On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest.

### ${Object}$

You can try to move an object that weighs up to ${1,000}$ pounds. If the object isnâ€™t being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to ${15,,orange}$ studs in any direction, but not beyond the range of this spell.

If the object is worn or carried by a creature, you must make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by that creatureâ€™s ${Strength}$ check. If you succeed, you pull the object away from that creature and can move it up to ${15,,orange}$ studs in any direction but not beyond the range of this spell.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

import.name: Skeletal Cage
import.description:
You can transform any of your summoned skeletons into a prison created from the skeleton's bones, encasing a creature or object of a size as big or smaller than the construct from which the cage was created.

As you cast this, you may choose to ${Protect}$, or ${Restrain}$ the contents.

Small projectiles and directed magic may attack the object or creature within, otherwise attacks hit the skeleton first.

When the cage is dismissed, the skeleton collects and refits it's previous gear.

import.name: Bone Cage
import.description:
You may attempt to cage a creature adjacent to you as a ${Bonus Action}$ or a creature attacking you with a melee weapon as a ${Reaction}$.

Creatures caged by this ability are not considered restrained.

import.name: Bone Lance
import.description:
Lose 1d8 HP as part of casting this spell.

Launch a sliver of your form at a target, dealing piercing damage.

import.name: Compose Bone Golem
import.description:
You merge ${5,,orange}$ Skeletons into a formidable Bone Golem.

Maintaining the golem ${Locks}$ your Level ${4,,orange}$ spell slot.

See your knowledge for details on the golem.

Use of a Level ${7,,orange}$ slot allows the construction of any Bone Golem variation up to a Threat of ${7,,orange}$.

Use of a Level ${10,,orange}$ slot allows the construction of any Bone Golem variation up to a Threat of ${11,,orange}$.

import.name: Antilife Shell
import.description:
A shimmering barrier extends out from you in the spells radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and hedging out creatures other than undead and constructs. The barrier lasts for the duration.

The barrier prevents an affected creature from passing or reaching through. An affected creature can cast spells or make attacks with ranged or reach weapons through the barrier.

If you move so that an affected creature is forced to pass through the barrier, the spell ends.

import.name: Lance of Bone
import.description:
Conjure and hurl a lance made of bone.

If struck, the creature makes a ${Constitution}$ save and on failure suffers a greatly weakened Constitution, loosing ${6,,orange}$ points from the stat. This effect is considered a curse.

If the save is successful, no ${Necrotic}$ damage is suffered.

import.name: Bonfire
import.description:
You create a bonfire on ground that you can see within range.

Until the spell ends, the magic bonfire fills a 4 stud cube. Any creature in the bonfireâ€™s space when you cast the spell must succeed on a ${Dexterity}$ saving throw or take ${Fire}$ damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the bonfireâ€™s space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

The bonfire ignites flammable objects in its area that arenâ€™t being worn or carried.

import.name: Legend Lore
import.description:
Name or describe a person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about the thing you named. The lore might consist of current tales, forgotten stories, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. If the thing you named isnâ€™t of legendary importance, you gain no information. The more information you already have about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is.

The information you learn is accurate but might be couched in figurative language. For example, if you have a mysterious magic axe on hand, the spell might yield this information: â€œWoe to the evildoer whose hand touches the axe, for even the haft slices the hand of the evil ones. Only a true Child of Stone, lover and beloved of Moradin, may awaken the true powers of the axe, and only with the sacred word Rudnogg on the lips.â€


In some cases, you may be bestowed with a vision of what came to pass with the object or place, revealing deeper lore about the piece.

import.name: Mislead
import.description:
You become invisible at the same time that an illusory double of you appears where you are standing. The double lasts for the duration, but the invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.

You can use your ${Action}$ to move your illusory double up to twice your speed and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. You can see through its eyes and hear through its ears as if you were located where it is. On each of your turns as a ${Bonus Action}$, you can switch from using its Senses to using your own, or back again. While you are using its Senses, you are ${Blinded}$ and ${Deafened}$ in regard to your own surroundings.

import.name: Guardian of Faith
import.description:
A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The guardian occupies that space and is indistinct except for a gleaming sword and shield emblazoned with the symbol of your deity.

Any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within this spell's radius of the guardian for the first time on a turn must succeed on a ${Dexterity}$ saving throw. The creature takes ${20,,orange}$ ${Radiant}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The guardian has ${60,,orange}$HP, ${5 + wis,,orange}$AC, and automatically fails any saving throws.

import.name: Ray of Frost
import.description:
A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged ${Spell Attack}$ against the target. On a hit, it takes ${Cold}$ damage, and its speed is reduced by ${5,,orange}$ studs until the start of your next turn, gaining the effect ${Chilled Movement}$.

Gains an additional damage dice with every 5 levels.

import.name: Chain of Command
import.description:
You attempt to compel a creature bound in your chains to perform a simple action, such as attack , move, or retrieve or drop a small item.

On a failed save, they follow the command as long as they are chained. At the end of each of that creature's turns, they make another save until the spell ends or they succeed their save.

Optionally the skull on the end of the chain can be detonated for an additional 2d12 ${Necrotic}$ damage.

import.name: Feast of Souls
import.description:
Drain the soul from a dead creature or an injured creature below ${50%,,orange}$ life that you have ${Restrained}$.

If the creature is dead or unconscious, there is no save, but a living creature may resist, taking half damage on a successful save.

Once a dead creature has taken their maximum life in damage from this spell, their corpse rots instantly and their soul no longer exists within the planes of the universe.

If the caster is slain, an ${Umoya Crystal}$ drops for each creature whose soul the wraith has consumed and has not yet digested. Once a soul is digested, it can no longer be revived through "normal" means.

import.name: Possession
import.description:
You attempt to take possession of a body. If that creature fails its save, your corporeal form enters the target creature and you control its actions.

When you take control of a body, all charm effects against it are ended and while in that body, you have advantage on saving throws against ${Charm}$ effects.

While inside a creature, ${Radiant}$ and ${Fire}$ damage hurt the host creature as well as yourself.

import.name: Summon Lesser Demons
import.description:
You utter foul words, summoning demons from the chaos of the Abyss. Roll 1d6:
+ 1â€“2: Two demons of ${Threat}$ 2 or lower
+ 3â€“4: Four demons of ${Threat}$ 1 or lower
+ 5â€“6: Eight demons of ${Threat}$ 0

You have no control of the demons summoned, but you do control where they are summoned.

The demons are hostile to all creatures, including you. Roll initiative for the summoned demons as a group, which has its own turns. The demons pursue and attack the nearest non-demons to the best of their ability.

As part of casting the spell, you can form a circle on the ground with the blood used as a material component. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. While the spell lasts, the summoned demons canâ€™t cross the circle or harm it, and they canâ€™t target anyone within it. Using the material component in this manner consumes it when the spell ends.

If you lose or break concentration, the demons remain summoned, only the circle of protection breaks.

When cast at level ${6,,orange}$ or ${7,,orange}$, the number of demons summoned is doubled. At level ${8,,orange}$ or ${9,,orange}$, the number of demons summoned is trippled.

import.name: Summon Greater Demon
import.description: You utter foul words, summoning one demon from the chaos of the Abyss. You choose the demon's type, which must be known to you and one of ${Threat 6}$ or lower. Roll initiative for the demon, which has its own turns. When you summon it and on each of your turns thereafter, you can issue a verbal command to it (requiring no action on your part), telling it what it must do on its next turn. If you issue no command, it spends its turn attacking any creature within reach that has attacked it. At the end of each of the demonâ€™s turns, it makes a ${Charisma}$ saving throw. The demon has disadvantage on this saving throw if you say its true name. On a failed save, the demon continues to obey you. On a successful save, your control of the demon ends for the rest of the duration, and the demon spends its turns pursuing and attacking the nearest non-demons to the best of its ability. As part of casting the spell, you can form a circle on the ground with 1 ${Spell Inkwell}$ for each creature to contain within the circle. While the spell lasts, the summoned demon canâ€™t cross the circle or harm it, and it canâ€™t target anyone within it as long as the spell has not ended and you maintain concentration. The demon does not disappear at the end of the spell, however your control over it does. When cast at a higher level, you gain an addition Threat for every level above ${4,,orange}$th Level. For example, casting this at ${6,,orange}$th Level would allow you to summon a demon of ${Threat 8}$ or lower.

import.name: Hellish Rebuke
import.description: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a saving throw and takes half damage on success.

import.name: Darkness
import.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill the spell's area for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with ${Darkvision}$ canâ€™t see through this darkness, and non-magical light canâ€™t illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isnâ€™t being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spellâ€™s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of ${2,,orange}$<sup>nd</sup> level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

import.name: Rotraru's Arc Field
import.description:
A field appears on the ground, electrifying any creatures inside the area. This applies to any creatures, both friend and foe on the ground in the area. Creatures that succeed on their save take half damage.

In addition to taking damage, the field makes the area ${Difficult Terrain}$

Any creature that takes more than ${30,,orange}$ damage of ${Lightning}$ after reductions becomes  ${Paralyzed}$.

import.name: Spell Siphon
import.description:
Interrupt another spell caster's spell. If that spell is cast at the level of your cast of ${Spell Siphon}$ or lower, the spell is ${Siphoned}$.

Once a spell is siphoned, you know of the spell and must choose new target(s) for it and you are considered the caster of the new spell.

If the spell is higher than your cast level, make an ${Intelligence}$ save against the casted spell.

For example, casting this at ${6,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level vs a ${8,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level spell is a DC of "${13,,orange}$ + (${6,,orange}$ - ${8,,orange}$)" for a DC of ${15,,orange}$.

For another example, casting this at ${6,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level vs a ${7,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level spell is a DC of "${13,,orange}$ + (${7,,orange}$ - ${6,,orange}$)" for a DC of ${14,,orange}$.

import.name: Plant Lash
import.description: Can use a charge to erupt an ${Acidic Burst}$ to cause a ${Constitution}$ Save and on fail takes an additional ${dex,,orange}$d10 ${Acid}$.

import.name: Vine Constrict
import.description: Restrains the effected creature, however the vine can't attack. If the vine is struck, it has to roll for concentration.

import.name: Consume Body
import.description: Consume a near-by corpse or item.
import.note: The vine of a Referri Plant will often consume lingering corpses or magical items to feed the main plant. Commonly drawn to the aura of a Power Crystal or Corpse.

import.name: Summon Referri Vine
import.description:
Summons a ${Referri Vine}$ to target location.

Any creature within range of the summoned vine must pass a saving throw or take damage. No damage is taken on a sucessful save.

import.name: Acid Arrow
import.description:
A shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d4 ${Acid}$ damage immediately and 2d4 ${Acid}$ damage at the end of its next turn.

On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with ${Acid}$ for half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of ${3}$<sup>rd</sup> level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

import.name: Mage Armor
import.description:
You touch a willing creature who isnâ€™t wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The targetâ€™s base AC becomes ${13,,orange}$ (Still allowing ${Dexterity}$ modifier to be added).

The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

import.name: Encasement
import.description:
As an action, you can encase your self in a block of ice whose HP is ${5 + 2 * Temporary HP}$ for up to ${wis,,orange}$ turns.

Until the spell ends or until the ice block is broken, you heal for 1d8 at the end of each turn.

You are still conscious while encased in ice and can control or continue to concentrate on any spells already active. Damage to the ice does not induce a ${Concentration}$ roll.

While encased in ice, ${Cold}$ damage received is reduced and ${Fire}$ damage received is multiplied.

import.name: Flame Strike
import.description:
Summon a column of divine flame, dealing fire damage to all caught within the 5 stud radius and 20 block high column.

On a successful save, targets take half damage.

For every level above the ${5,,orange}$<sup>th</sup>, you may add 1d6 ${Fire}$ or 1d6 ${Radiant}$ damage.

import.name: Ancient Golem Constriction
import.description:
Bind a creature.

That creature takes 2d12 ${Crushing}$ damage a round and is ${Restrained}$ and ${Silenced}$.

Any creature can attempt an ${Athletics}$ check against the Golem's ${Strength}$ save and on success can remove the restrained creature.

Additionally, this requires concentration and on a failed save, the restrained creature is released.

import.name: Ancient Golem Acid Cloud
import.description:
Cover a small area in an acidic poisonous cloud.

On a successful save, a creature takes half damage.

At the end of every round, roll 1d6, on a 6 this ability regains a charge.
import.note: Take a short rest to regain a charge.

import.name: Bite
import.description: Bite target creature

import.name: Bite
import.description: Bite target creature

import.name: Claw
import.description: Claw target creature.

import.name: Dispel Good or Evil
import.description:
Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from fey, undead, and creatures originating from beyond the ${Material Plane}$. For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have disadvantage on ${Attack}$ rolls against you.

You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions:
+ ${Break Enchantment}$: As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is ${Charmed}$, ${Frightened}$, or ${Possessed}$ by a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, a Fiend, or an Undead. The creature you touch is no longer ${Charmed}$, ${Frightened}$, or ${Possessed}$ by such creatures.
+ ${Dismissal}$: As your ${Action}$, make a ${Melee Spell Attack}$ against a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, a Fiend, or an Undead you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a ${Charisma}$ saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isnâ€™t there already). If they arenâ€™t on their home plane, Undead are sent to the ${Shadowfell}$, and Fey are sent to the ${Feywild}$. As part of ${Dismissal}$, roll an additional 1d6 whether you hit or not; On a ${5,,orange}$ or ${6,,orange}$, the ${Green Power Crystal}$ shatters. Though note that some creatures may stress the crystal to the point of shattering regardless of your roll.

The ${Green Power Crystal}$ is not consumed by using this spell. Though, it can shatter from the stress of use.

import.name: Power Word: Kill
import.description:
You point to a creature within range of you and utter a single word. That creature performs a ${Constitution}$ DC${50,,orange}$ save or immediately dies. On success, the creature takes 20d20 damage.

Requires a ${Golden Halo Formation}$ (${3,,orange}$+) and knowledge of the ${Ancient}$ language to perform this spell. Additionally, 1 of the power crystals in the formation are consumed.
import.note: Notable circumstance for corpseless rebirth are the plane of origin and the plane of death.

import.name: Power Word: Stun
import.description:
You point to a creature within range of you and utter a single word. That creature performs a ${Constitution}$ DC${50,,orange}$ save or immediately dies. On success, the creature takes 50d8 damage.

Requires a ${Purple Arcane Formation}$ (${2,,orange}$+) and knowledge of the ${Ancient}$ language to perform this spell. Once cast, roll 1d6; On 5 or 6, the ${Red Power Crystal}$ shatters.

import.name: Erellia's Magnificent Mansion
import.description:
You conjure an extradimensional dwelling in range that lasts for the duration. You choose where its one entrance is located. The entrance shimmers faintly and is 5 studs wide and 10 studs tall. You and any creature you designate when you cast the spell can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as the portal remains open. You can open or close the portal if you are within 30 studs of it. While closed, the portal is invisible.
Beyond the portal is a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

You can create any floor plan you like, but the space canâ€™t exceed 50 cubes, each cube being 10 studs on each side. The place is furnished and decorated as you choose. It contains sufficient food to serve a nine-course banquet for up to 100 people. A staff of 100 near-transparent servants attends all who enter. You decide the visual appearance of these servants and their attire. They are completely obedient to your orders. Each servant can perform any task a normal human servant could perform, but they canâ€™t attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Thus the servants can fetch things, clean, mend, fold clothes, light fires, serve food, pour wine, and so on. The servants can go anywhere in the mansion but canâ€™t leave it. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from the mansion. When the spell ends, any creatures inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance.

Once cast, roll 1d6. On a 5 or lower, the Power Crystal is not consumed.

import.name: Regenerate
import.description:
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains hit points and for the duration of the spell regains an additional 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns after that (10 hit points each minute).

The targetâ€™s severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the spell instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

Once cast, roll 1d6. On a 4 or lower, the Power Crystal is not consumed.

import.name: Forceage
import.description:
An immobile, invisible, cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box, as you choose.

A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out from the area. You may choose to allow matter os spells to pass through, but can not change it after and can not designate any restrictions beyond this.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cageâ€™s area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside the area, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside the area.

A creature inside the cage canâ€™t leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave the cage, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failure, the creature canâ€™t exit the cage and wastes the use of the spell or effect. The cage also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel.

Once cast, roll 1d6. On a 3 or lower, the Power Crystal is not consumed.

import.name: Arcane Orbital
import.description:
You take up to ${wis+int+cha,,orange}$ ${Power Crystals}$ and suspend them in orbit around your primary arm.

Spells you cast become empowered. Anytime you cast a spell, roll 1d6 for each crystal in the orbital, a crystal is destroyed for each 6. You habe some control over crystals that are destroyed this way, choosing which crystals to strain. Crystals destroyed this way are in addition to any crystals that are destroyed with the cost of the spell, if any.

Once the orbital is established, it continues until the spell ends or all the power crystals are destroyed. At the end of the spell, any remaining power crystals disintegrate.

import.name: Detect Clam
import.description:
For the duration of the spell, as long as you maintain concentration, you are able to sense sea creatures within range.

Your sense is blocked by any barrier thicker than 2 studs.

import.name: Flame Web
import.description:
Create a line of thick web between you and a point on the ground or other terrain.

This web immediately catches fire and any creature attempting to pass it must succeed a ${Dexterity}$ save or take 2d12 ${Fire}$ damage. No damage is taken on success. 

This damage does _NOT_ count as ${Area of Effect}$ when crossed willingly.

This damage _DOES_ count as ${Area of Effect}$ if you move to make it hit any number of creatures.

import.name: Web of Necrosis
import.description:
If a creature fails its save, it is immediately cocooned in thick purple webbing, ${Restraining}$ and ${Silencing}$ that creature.

Each turn, that creature is slowly dissolved, taking 3d12 ${Necrotic}$ damage.

If a creature falls to ${0,,orange}$HP inside the webbing, it is dead and is a liquid encased in the webbing.

The webbing has 5 times your ${Constitution}$ modifier health; ${5*con,,orange}$HP and inherits your resistances.

import.name: Acidic Encasing
import.description:
If a creature fails its save, it is immediately cocooned in thick purple webbing, ${Restraining}$ and ${Silencing}$ that creature.

Each turn, that creature is slowly dissolved, taking 3d6 ${Acid}$ damage.

If a creature dies inside the webbing, its body becomes a liquid encased in the webbing (Fall unconscious then fail all death saves).

The webbing has ${3,,orange}$ times your ${Constitution}$ modifier health; ${5*con,,orange}$HP and inherits your resistances.

import.name: Necrotic Touch
import.description:
You churn the once living flesh of a creature against it, rotting the adjacent living flesh.

On a successful save, the effected creature takes half as much damage as it would take otherwise.

The damage dealt by this spell can not exceed the ${Missing HP}$ of the targeted creature.

Example: ${60,,orange}$ damage against a a creature that is at ${80,,orange}$/${100,,orange}$ HP could only cause ${20,,orange}$ damage. Then if the creature succeeds their save, they instead take ${10,,orange}$ damage.

When cast at ${Level 8}$, the creature can take ${50,,orange}$% more damage (30 per the above example, reduced to 15 on a successful save). At ${Level 10}$ it can take twice its ${Missing HP}$ (40 in the above example, reduced to 20 on a successful save).

After casting, roll 1d6. The Power Crystal shatters on a 6. Otherwise it continues to be usable.

import.name: Dimensional Containment
import.description:
Channeling arcane energies, you suppress a cross realm entrance or portal so that it can not be crossed for the duration of the enchantment.

Some portals or realm rifts may resist the enchantment and require an ${Arcana}$ check against them to determine if the enchantment can take effect.

This enchantment notably leaves the portal intact, however if the enchantment successfully takes effect, you may choose to collapse the entrance.

Note that this enchantment can be dispelled from either end. Casting the spell at a higher levels makes this removal more difficult.

Additionally, the spell notes that an ${Umoya Crystal}$ can be used in place of a normal Gemstone to improve the enchantment's resillience against being dispelled.

import.name: Conjure Red Orb
import.description:
Conjure a ${Red Aligned}$ orb of power at a location in the air.

This orb is linked to you and imbues you with additional power when attacking or using any spells or abilities, including this one.

If an orb is already active, you may conjure another at no cost during your turn.

Only 1 orb may be conjured per round.

For any listed effect of an orb, ${Line of Sight}$ is required.

If an orb is out of your line of sight for longer than 1 hour, it fades naturally.

---

When attacking, each active orb adds 1d6 damage to your attacks.

When attacked, each orb strikes out at the attacker for 1d6 ${Fire}$ damage.

Spells cast receive an additional 1d6 of ${Fire}$ damage.
import.icon: fad fa-planet-ringed rs-light-red rs-secondary-white rs-secondary-solid rot135

import.name: Slow
import.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in range. Each target must succeed on a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected targetâ€™s speed is halved, it takes a ${âˆ’2,,orange}$ penalty to AC and ${Dexterity}$ saving throws, and it canâ€™t use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an ${Action}$ or a ${Bonus Action}$, not both. Regardless of the creatureâ€™s abilities or magic items, it canâ€™t make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 ${Action}$, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesnâ€™t take effect until the creatureâ€™s next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it canâ€™t, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another ${Wisdom}$ saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

import.name: Gaes
import.description:
You place a magical command on a creature that you can see within range, forcing it to carry out some service or refrain from some action or course of activity as you decide. If the creature can understand you, it must succeed on a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw or become ${Charmed}$ by you for the duration. While the creature is charmed by you, it takes 5d10 ${Psychic}$ damage each time it acts in a manner directly counter to your instructions, but no more than once each day. A creature that can't understand you is unaffected by the spell.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.

You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. A ${Remove Curse}$, ${Greater Restoration}$, or ${Wish}$ spell also ends it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the duration is 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

Once cast, roll 1d6. On a 6, the power crystal used shatters.

import.name: Necrosis Cloud
import.description: Release a cloud of Necrotic Acid that overwhelms a creature, slowly building damage while a creature remains inside the gas, increasing the damage by 1 die each time, building to 2d12 Necrotic & Acid, then 3d12.

import.name: Commune with Nature
import.description:
You briefly become one with nature and gain knowledge of the surrounding territory. In the outdoors, the spell gives you knowledge of the land within 3 miles of you. In caves and other natural underground settings, the radius is limited to 200 studs. The spell doesnâ€™t function where nature has been replaced by construction, such as in dungeons and towns.

You instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area:  
+ Terrain and bodies of water
+ Prevalent plants, minerals, animals, or peoples
+ Powerful celestials, fey, fiends, elementals, or undead
+ Influence from other planes of existence
+ Buildings

For example, you could determine the location of powerful undead in the area, the location of major sources of safe drinking water, and the location of any nearby towns.

import.name: Bardic Heroism
import.description:
You play a small tune to boost the moral of nearby friends.

All friendly creature who can hear you for the duration of the tune gain the effect ${Bardic Heroism}$ and are immune to ${Frighten}$ and ${Fear}$ effects.

If they take damage, they must succeed a ${Concentration}$ save or lose the effect as the tune fades from their mind.

The instrument used may effect this spell.

If the instrument has any special magic associated with it, those may trigger with this spell.

import.name: Armor of Erellia
import.description:
You or a willing creature you can touch receive the effect ${Erellia's Armor}$ granting ${5,,orange}$ ${Temporary HP}$ that is regained every ${12,,orange}$ seconds (${2,,orange}$ rounds).

When struck by a melee attack while that creature has any ${Temporary HP}$, the striking creature takes 1d8 ${Cold}$ damage.

Once cast, roll 1d6. On a ${6,,orange}$, the ${Power Crystal}$ disintigrates.

import.name: Summoning Ritual
import.description:
Using various power crystals, a creature can be summoned through this spell or communed with during its duration.

The creature and communication that can be achieved hinges on the Power Crystals used as part of the spell.

import.name: Strength Surge
import.description: Sinking your teeth into a creature,  you can move or throw that creature with ease but in your fury, you do harm the creature whether intended or not.

import.name: Sentinel Eye
import.description:
You create a visible purple ball with an eye facing one direction that hovers in the air for the duration.

You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and ${Dark Vision}$ out to ${15,,orange}$ studs. The eye can turn and look in any direction but only has a 60<sup>o</sup> viewing arc.

As an ${Action}$, you can move the eye up to ${15,,orange}$ studs in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it canâ€™t enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eyeâ€™s movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as ${1,,orange}$ stud in diameter.

Additionally as an ${Action}$, you may command the eye to ${Attack}$ with 4 arcane beams dealing 1d6 ${Force}$ damage each, but all beams must target the same creature.

When this spell is cast at higher levels, any attack orders gain an additional beam for every level over 4<sup>th</sup> level.

When cast at 7<sup>th</sup> level or higher with any ${Arcane Orbital}$ is use, a crystal from the orbital can be strained to create another eye. These eyes persist even after the orbital is fully consumed.

import.name: Orbital Projection
import.description:
You toss up to 4 Red, Blue, or Green Power Crystals in front of you as you cast this spell. Each crystal is consumed and spawns a ${Sphere of Power}$ along side you that matches its color.

When cast at 7<sup>th</sup> level you may use 5 crystals.

When cast at 9<sup>th</sup> level you may use 6 crystals.

#### ${Red Sphere of Power}$

Once per round as a ${Free Action}$, you may unleash a bolt of flame at a target creature for ${2 + int,,orange}$d6 ${Fire}$ damage (Dice scale with your ${Intelligence}$ modifier [${int,,orange}$]).

Additionally, each red sphere will retaliate against any creature that attacks you, ${Attacking}$ with a firebolt for 1d6 ${Fire}$ damage.

#### ${Blue Sphere of Power}$

As an ${Action}$ you may have 1 blue sphere focus on a target creature within to ${Silence}$ it. Each sphere can only focus on one creature, but multiple spheres will allow multiple creatures to be silenced. Any silenced creature is silenced until you choose another creature for that sphere to focus or until that creature is out of the spell's range.
This silence immediately halts all ${Concentration}$ and is treated as a ${Curse}$.

Additionally, each blue sphere increases your AC by ${1,,orange}$.

#### ${Green Sphere of Power}$

Once per round as a ${Bonus Action}$, you may channel healing energy into a friendly creature, healing them for ${wis,,orange}$d6 damage (Dice scale with your ${Wisdom}$ modifier [${wis,,orange}$]).

Additionally, each green sphere passive heals you for 1d6 at the end of your turn.
import.note:
If a silence curse is removed, the sphere dissipates.

Sphere dissipate when hit with magic of a contrary damage or type.

Spheres can be dispelled, but only one at a time.

An AoE dispel purges all.

Dispelling does require a roll against the sphere for the level at which the spell was cast.

Lime crystals require an Arcana check and a color choice.

Silver allows you to transition a creature to another plane as an action.

Gold allows you to conjure or summon creatures by name up to a threat of 20 in total. So 1 Threat 20 creature or 20 1 Threat creatures. Requires knowledge of the creature to conjure it. Requires an intimate name to summon it. In the case of otherwise nameless animals or creatures, an intimate name is still required for that creature in it's native tongue to summon it. Can not summon across planes.

import.name: Erellia's Arcane Hand
import.description:
You create a large hand of shimmering, translucent force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the spellâ€™s duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.

The hand is an object that has AC ${20,,orange}$ and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a ${Strength}$ of 26 (+8) and a ${Dexterity}$ of 10 (+0). The hand doesnâ€™t fill its space.

When you cast the spell and as a ${Bonus Action}$ on your subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to ${30,,orange}$ studs and then cause one of the following effects with it.

+ ${Clenched Fist}$: The hand strikes one creature or object within ${4,,orange}$ studs of it. Make a ${Melee Spell Attack}$ for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes 4d8 ${Force}$ damage.

+ ${Forceful Hand}$: The hand attempts to push a creature within ${4,,orange}$ studs of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the handâ€™s ${Strength}$ contested by an ${Athletics}$ check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to ${4,,orange}$ studs plus a number of studs equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier (${cast,,orange}$). The hand moves with the target to remain within ${4,,orange}$ studs of it.

+ ${Grasping Hand}$: The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within ${4,,orange}$ studs of it. You use the handâ€™s ${Strength}$ score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. While the hand is grappling the target, you can use a ${Bonus Action}$ to have the hand crush it. When you do so, the target takes ${Bludgeoning}$ damage equal to ${2d6 + cast,,orange}$.

+ ${Interposing Hand}$: The hand interposes itself between you and a creature you choose until you give the hand a different command. The hand moves to stay between you and the target, providing you with half cover against the target. The target canâ€™t move through the handâ€™s space if its ${Strength}$ score is less than or equal to the handâ€™s ${Strength}$ score. If its ${Strength}$ score is higher than the handâ€™s ${Strength}$ score, the target can move toward you through the handâ€™s space, but that space is difficult terrain for the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the clenched fist option increases by 2d8 and the damage from the grasping hand increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 5th.

import.name: Prismatic Spray
import.description:
Eight multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each ray is a different color and has a different power and purpose. Each creature within range inside the cone must make a ${Dexterity}$ saving throw. For each target, roll a d8 to determine which color ray affects it.

1. ${Red}$: The target takes 10d6 ${Force}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

2. ${Violet}$: The target takes 10d6 ${Necrotic}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

3. ${Orange}$: The target takes 10d6 ${Fire}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

4. ${Green}$: The target takes 10d6 ${Poison}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

5. ${Blue}$: The target takes 10d6 ${Lightning}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

6. ${Yellow}$: On a failed save, the target is restrained. It must then make a ${Constitution}$ saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the ${Petrified}$ condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

7. ${Indigo}$: On a failed save, the target is blinded. It must then make a ${Wisdom}$ saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is transported to another plane of existence of the GM's choosing and is no longer ${Blinded}$. (Typically, a creature that is on a plane that isn't its home plane is banished home, while other creatures are usually cast into the Astral or Ethereal planes.) 

8. ${Special}$: The target is struck by two rays. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.

import.name: Counterspell
import.description:
Interrupt another spell caster's spell. If that spell is cast at the level of your cast of ${Counterspell}$ or lower, the spell is cancelled.

If the spell is higher than your cast level, make an ${Intelligence}$ save against the casted spell.

For example, casting this at ${3,,orange}$<sup>rd</sup> level vs a ${5,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level spell is a DC of "${13,,orange}$ + (${5,,orange}$ - ${3,,orange}$)" for a DC of ${15,,orange}$.

For another example, casting this at ${6,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level vs a ${7,,orange}$<sup>th</sup> level spell is a DC of "${13,,orange}$ + (${7,,orange}$ - ${6,,orange}$)" for a DC of ${14,,orange}$.

In the case where multiple creatures may want to counter a spell, they _MUST_ declare that they are attempting to counter the spell and if someone succeeds before they roll to counter, they can make a ${Wisdom}$ save DC15 to stop casting and save their ${Reaction}$, otherwise the ${Spell Slot}$ and ${Reaction}$ are consumed.

import.name: Arms of Hadar
import.description: You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 8 studs of you. Each creature in that area must make a ${Strength}$ saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 2d6 Necrotic damage and canâ€™t take reactions until its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.

import.name: Armor of Agathys
import.description:
A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as a spectral frost that covers you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.

**At Higher Levels:** When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot.

import.name: Eldritch Blast
import.description:
A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

import.name: Protection from Good and Evil
import.description:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

import.name: Dissonant Whispers
import.description: You whisper a discordant melody that only one creature of your choice within range can hear, wracking it with terrible pain. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d6 psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesnâ€™t move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesnâ€™t have to move away. A deafened creature automatically succeeds on the save.

import.name: Arcane Gate
import.description:
You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points on the ground that you can see, one point within 8 studs of you and one point within range of you. A circular portal, 10 feet in diameter, opens over each point. If the portal would open in the space occupied by a creature, the spell fails, and the casting is lost.

The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist, hovering inches from the ground and perpendicular to it at the points you choose. A ring is visible only from one side (your choice), which is the side that functions as a portal.

Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other; passing through a portal from the nonportal side has no effect. The mist that fills each portal is opaque and blocks vision through it. On your turn, you can rotate the rings as a ${Bonus Action}$ so that the active side faces in a different direction.

Requires an ${Arcana}$ DC${10,,orange}$ to keep the crystal from disintigrating.

import.name: Mass Suggestion
import.description:
You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence up to twelve creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear and understand you. Creatures that canâ€™t be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable.

Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act automatically negates the effect of the spell. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do. You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration.

For example, you might suggest that a group of soldiers give all their money to the first beggar they meet. If the condition isnâ€™t met before the spell ends, the activity isnâ€™t performed. If you or any of your companions damage a creature affected by this spell, the spell ends for that creature.


Requires an ${Arcana}$ DC${10,,orange}$ to keep the crystal from disintegrating.

import.name: True Seeing
import.description:
This spell gives the willing creature you touch the ability to see things as they actually are. For the duration, the creature has ${Truesight}$, notices secret doors hidden by magic, and can see into the Ethereal Plane, all out to a range of 100 studs.

Requires an ${Arcana}$ or ${Religion}$ DC${10,,orange}$ to keep the crystal from disintegrating.
